page.title: 18CHURCH,HALL,AND PARK
page.content: were made by Thomas Rickman.However,by 1856,the church was thought to be in need of drastic restoration.The work of Victorian architect,G.E.Street,left only the south east corner unaltered. In 1860,the present{churchyard wall was built,and in 1860, the spire was added.In 1876,the{lych gate}was built,and in 1885,a peal of 8{bells, made by Mears and Stainbank of London, was hung in the tower. {Hagley Hall} The Lyttelton family lived at nearby Frankley until Sir John Lyttelton bought Hagley in 1564 and built a timber framed manor house on the present cricket pitch.Here,Stephen Lyttelton and Robert Wayntow were seized for their part in the{Gunpowder {Plot. The present Hagley Hall was largely the work of George,1st.Lord Lyttelton.
